org.simplity.rest.param

Class Parameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.rest.param.Parameter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayParameter, BooleanParameter, DateParameter, IntParameter, NumberParameter, ObjectParameter, TextParameter

    public abstract class Parameter
extends Object
    Base class for different types of parameters.
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected String name
        name of this parameter as used by swagger for input/output

      • fieldName

        protected String fieldName
        name as used by actual service. input parameter extracts data into this name while output parameter extracts data using this name. Defaults to name if this is not specified in the spec

      • schemaName

        protected String schemaName
        schema that is used to define the fields, if this is either object, or array of objects. null if this is primitive, or the schema is defined in-line

      • isRequired

        protected boolean isRequired
        is this mandatory

      • defaultValue

        protected Object defaultValue
        default value to be used if this is optional, and client has not sent a value

      • validValues

        protected Object[] validValues
        list of valid values

                              String fieldName,
                              JSONObject param)
        parse swagger document node into an appropriate Parameter
        Parameters:
        name - as used in swagger
        fieldName - if service uses a different name

        Returns:
        parameter as per the specification

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns:
        name of this parameter

      • getFieldName

        public String getFieldName()
        Returns:
        name of the field. For an input parameter, this is the name with which data is to be written service data after extraction from input. For an output parameter, this is the to be used to extract data from service output.

      • validate

        public final Object validate(Object value,
                             List<FormattedMessage> messages)
        Parameters:
        value - could be null, in which case returned value is null even if validation succeeds.
        messages - error message added to this list in case of validation failure. checking for
        Returns:
        validated, and possibly formatted, object. null if validation fails, or if input was null.

      • toWriter

        public void toWriter(JSONWriter writer,
                     Object data,
                     boolean asAttribute)
        write this parameter into a json writer. For example "fieldName":"value", or just "value" if justTheValue is true
        Parameters:
        writer -
        data -
        asAttribute - if this is true, then we write key,value pair, else we write just the value and not as an attribute.

      • enableRequired

        public void enableRequired()
        make this parameter mandatory

      • getSchemaName

        public String getSchemaName()
        in case this is an object, or array of objects, what is the
        Returns:
        class/message/schema name that describes the structure of this parameter. null if this is primitive, or is defined in-line without a definition
